intro: Roupala schomburgkii, commonly known as the Schomburgk's roupala, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences, typically blooming in the spring. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Roupala schomburgkii is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and montane forest habitats.
